description: This recipe is just as good cold as it is hot, so use any leftovers to make packed lunches. This is designed to be a low cost recipe.

default: 2 x 185g/6½oz tin tuna, drained and broken into bite-sized pieces

steps: Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil and add a generous pinch of salt. Cook the pasta according to packet instructions. Once cooked, drain and transfer to a large serving bowl.
Mix the olive oil into the cooked pasta and season with salt and pepper. Stir through the tuna and add the zest of the lemon along with the juice of half of the lemon.
Just before serving toss through the rocket leaves.
tips: In May 2013 this recipe was costed at £3.05 at Asda, £3.56 at Tesco and £3.71 at Sainsbury’s. This recipe is designed to be made in conjunction with a low-cost store-cupboard.
title: Tuna, rocket and lemon pasta
